intro: Amaracarpus rotensis, commonly known as the Rotensian amara, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature, contributing to its propagation in the wild.
